pull.title: test: Move test_chain_listunspent wallet check from mempool_packages to wallet_basic
pull.body:
This fixes a bug.

On master:

```
$ ./test/functional/mempool_packages.py  --legacy-wallet 
  File "./test/functional/mempool_packages.py", line 52, in run_test
    self.nodes[0].importaddress(self.wallet.get_address())
test_framework.authproxy.JSONRPCException: Bech32m addresses cannot be imported into legacy wallets (-5)
```

On this pull, all tests pass.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#20892](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20892) (tests: Run both descriptor and legacy tests within a single test invocation by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
(An alternative to test this would be to compile with bdb only)
Is there a reason that this test needs the wallet in the first place?

issue.title: tests: Run both descriptor and legacy tests within a single test invocation
issue.body: Instead of having the tests only do one type or the other, depending on command line arguments, these tests should be running with both types of wallets. Any test that calls `add_wallet_options` will be run for each wallet type that it specifies a wallet option for if none are give in the command line. If a particular wallet is specified with `--legacy-wallet` or `--descriptors`, the options are still respected.

events.body: Yeah, the test doesn't need the wallet, but it is providing mempool-package coverage for the `listunspent` wallet RPC. So maybe an alternative would be to move it out into a new test, idk?

> Yeah, the test doesn't need the wallet, but it is providing mempool-package coverage for the listunspent wallet RPC. So maybe an alternative would be to move it out into a new test, idk?

Would be in favor of moving the listunspent coverage to a new/existing `wallet_` functional test instead.
